title: Self-hosting guide (Docker Compose)
description: Create comprehensive documentation for self-hosting Neon using Docker Compose. This guide should enable developers to run the complete Neon stack locally or on their own infrastructure with minimal friction.
acceptance_criteria: docker-compose.yml with all services (ClickHouse, Temporal, Frontend)
Works on Linux, macOS, and Windows (WSL2)
implementation_notes: Use official images where possible (clickhouse/clickhouse-server, temporalio/auto-setup)
Include volume mounts for data persistence
Provide both development and production compose files
Test on fresh machine to ensure completeness
